t: Psalm 86
Lament and Petition
A prayer of David.
Listen,*pn Lord,*s and answer me, for*ln I am poor and needy.
Protect*ln my life, for I am faithful. You*ln are my God; save your servant who trusts in you.
Be*ln gracious to me, Lord, for*ln I call to you all day long.
Bring*ln joy to your servantâ€™s life, because*ln I appeal to you, Lord.
For*pn you, Lord, are kind and ready to forgive, abounding*ln in faithful love to all who call on you.
Lord,*sln hear my prayer; listen*ln to my cries for mercy.
I*ln call on you in the day of my distress, for*ln you will answer me.
Lord,*pn there is no one like you among the gods, and*ln there are no works like yours.
All*ln the nations you have made will*ln come and bow down before you, Lord, and*ln will honor your name.
For*ln you are great and perform wonders; you*ln alone are God.
Teach*pn me your way, Lord,*s and*ln I will live by your truth. Give*ln me an undivided mind to fear your name.
I*ln will praise you with all my heart, Lord my God, and*ln will honor your name forever.
For*ln your faithful love for me is great, and*ln you rescue my life from the depths of Sheol.
God,*pn arrogant people have attacked me; a*ln gang of ruthless men intends to kill me. They*ln do not let you guide them.
But*ln you, Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God, slow*ln to anger and abounding in faithful love and truth.
Turn*ln to me and be gracious to me. Give*ln your strength to your servant; save*ln the son of your female servant.
Show*ln me a sign of your goodness; my*ln enemies will see and be put to shame because*ln you, Lord,*s have helped and comforted me.
